Package com.github.kaktushose.jda.commands.annotations

Annotation Type Command

  • @Target(METHOD)
@Retention(RUNTIME)
public @interface Command
    Methods annotated with Command will be registered as a command at startup.

    Therefore the method must be declared inside a class that is annotated with CommandController. Furthermore, the method signature has to meet the following conditions:

    • First parameter must be of type CommandEvent
    • Remaining parameter types must be registered at the TypeAdapterRegistry or be a String array
    • Parameter constraints must be valid
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Kaktushose
    See Also:
    CommandController, Constraint

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      String category
      Returns the category of the command.
      String desc
      Returns the description of the command.
      boolean isActive
      Returns whether this command is active and thus can be executed or not
      boolean isDM
      Returns whether this command can be executed in direct messages.
      boolean isSuper
      Returns whether this command is a super command.
      String name
      Returns the name of the command.
      String usage
      Returns the usage of the command.
      String[] value
      Returns a String array of all labels.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        String[] value
        Returns a String array of all labels.
        Returns:
        a String array of all labels
        Default:
        {""}

      • isSuper

        boolean isSuper
        Returns whether this command is a super command. A super command will be listed separately in the default help embed and will have all non-super commands inside the same controller as a sub command.
        Returns:
        true if this is a super command
        Default:
        false

      • isDM

        boolean isDM
        Returns whether this command can be executed in direct messages.
        Returns:
        true if this command can be executed in direct messages
        Default:
        true

      • name

        String name
        Returns the name of the command. This is not the command label.
        Returns:
        the name of the command
        Default:
        "N/A"

      • desc

        String desc
        Returns the description of the command.
        Returns:
        the description of the command
        Default:
        "N/A"

      • usage

        String usage
        Returns the usage of the command.
        Returns:
        the usage of the command
        Default:
        "N/A"

      • category

        String category
        Returns the category of the command.
        Returns:
        the category of the command
        Default:
        "Other"

      • isActive

        boolean isActive
        Returns whether this command is active and thus can be executed or not
        Returns:
        true if this command is active
        Default:
        true
